original_title: Sri Lanka sells only Rs86.7bn in T-bill auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka sold only 86 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Wednesday after offering 120 billion while yields across maturities fell, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 57.8 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.66 percent, down 24 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 60 billion rupees.
Only 20.3 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.79 percent, down 33 basis points from a week earlier.
Only 8.5 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 24.31 percent, down one basis points from a week earlier after offering 30 billion. (Colombo/March29/2022)
